about.body: Experience administering RPM-based and Debian-based Linux distributions and FreeBSD servers. Experience administering Apache and Nginx web servers. Experience working with LUA, C#, Git, sqlite, MySQL, PHP, Perl, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Bash Shell Scripting, VueJS, Laravel and jQuery and a progressing knowledge of Java, Golang, ReactJS and Python

experience.title: Support Engineer
duties: Providing technical support for customers using the Brainspace Application, preparing their infrastructure and installation/upgrade of the application
Help develop and improve application documentation
Create internal training documentation for 3rd party applications utilized

Develop and maintain shell scripts that assist with preinstallation infrastructure checks, preparing version releases for dissemination to customers, reporting tools for clients, and demonstrate API usage
Aid in the testing of each release before dissemination to clients
Work with the development team and 3rd party vendors such as Relativity and Nuix toresolve issues that arose with client systems

experience.title: Owner
duties: Administer the Ubuntu based web servers running NodeJS-based backend APIs, a Laravel and Vue-based frontend, MySQL database backend
Services are on top of a Docker and Kubernetes virtualization layer utilizing Rancher
Administer the 4 nameservers, which are PowerDNS based and utilize a Galera-powered cluster of MySQL database servers to feed zone records to the nameservers
Oversee the administration of Ubuntu installations for client projects, apply security patches, and maintain the database, webserver, and other services as directed by the client’s contract

experience.title: Air Traffic Controller, Certified Professional Controller
duties: Provide weather briefing services to pilots conduct flights across the state of Alaska
Prepare, file and disseminate flight plan information for pilots conducting flights into, through or out of Alaska.
Provide briefings, inquiry resolution and flight plan filing in person, over the phone or over radio frequencies.
Prepare, disseminate and coordinate information regarding locating and initiating Search and Rescue for missing aircraft.
Cross trained at Barrow and Deadhorse, AK

experience.title: Lead Developer
duties: A site created for Flight Simulation hobbyists to have quick and easy access to aviation charts

Utilizing PHP, Git, Laravel, MySQL and Amazon AWS, created a search engine-like site featuring over 6000 lines of code including self healing, error detection, creation of "spiders" to retrieve aviation charts and store in Amazon AWS S3 buckets.
Created an interface ability to allow external programs access to the AirCharts database and the aeronautical charts
Created and maintained the mobile interface utilizing ReactJS.

experience.title: Data Services Manager
experience.company: Virtual Air Traffic Simulation Network (VATSIM), USA Division
duties: Oversaw a team of 4 people in the creation, management and maintenance of the IT systems used by the members of VATSIM
Rebuilt the public facing website from the original PHPv3 to Laravel
Created a public facing API for use within the organization, and documented using Swagger
Converted the website from an expired IPBoard licensed environment to SMF
Containerized the environments running within Docker Swarm
Open sourced all systems used by the division (https://github.com/vatusa)

experience.title: Air Traffic Controller, 1st Class
experience.location: Various, last was USS George Washington, Yokosuka, JP
duties: Was trained and certified at 3 Air Traffic Control facilities (NAS Pensacola, USS George Washington, and Iwo Jima).
Provided Air Traffic Control services to aircraft in the air and on the ground.
From 2010-2012, was responsible for the Training Program for my shift at NAS Pensacola and oversaw training and progression of young sailors and certification of instructors

From 2014-2015, was the 3M Work Center Supervisor responsible for overseeing maintenance in 24 shipboard compartments, 35 maintenance personnel, 1,800 yearly maintenance checks, 120 quality assurance checks, and 76 qualifications. Planned, disseminated and oversaw over 3,000 hours of compartment upkeep during pier-side time in preparation for deployment. Implemented a training program that resulted in zero discrepancies during the Navy Region’s Maintenance Inspection.
